chapter.title: Corporate Pass
chapter.para: Corporate Pass is a password you can create to allow your customers to enrol online whoever they want, as many times as they want, without having to pay up front. This password can be limited to certain classes or left open to access your entire range of classes. You can create as many passwords as you like for the same customer, and for as many different customers as you chose.

section.title: When to Use a Corporate Pass

listitem.para: You may have a large customer with quite a few staff to whom you provide training. Without corporate pass your choices are to have the staff enrol online with their own credit card or some corporate card, or to process the enrolments by hand in the office in conjunction with your customer's HR department. This involves a lot of co-ordination to check each student's availability. Instead, you can now create a Corporate Pass and give the password to the customer's HR department. They then hand it out to staff, who are able to enrol in whichever classes are most suitable to their own availability.

Perhaps you are using onCourse to track internal training delivery in your company. You might want to assign a price to classes to help with interdepartmental cost allocation. Corporate pass gives you the ability to create a separate password for each department, allow staff to book their own training, and then perform the backend accounting you require.

You deliver vocational training to the staff of several large mining companies. These staff need to be regularly accredited for some part of their job, but they have some flexibility to do their training around their work shifts. You can create a special landing page on your website for each of those companies, with links to the courses you deliver that are relevant to them, the password for Corporate Pass and all other relevant information. Then students are directed to that page for all their training information.

Students have to complete an audition or interview process to get into your programme of training. Once they are accepted, you would like them to be able to sign up to further training and tie their payments into a monthly billing process you already have in place. Just hand them a password and they can enrol 24 hours a day over the internet.

section.title: Controlling Usage
section.para: There are several ways to prevent abuse of a corporate pass.

listitem.para: Each pass can be restricted to one class or a selection of classes.
Create as many passes as you want, even for the same customer. That way you can limit each pass in different ways and track its usage.
Give the pass an expiry date.

Each pass has a special email address to which an invoice will be sent for each enrolment. Typically this is your customer's HR department or staff manager who will be able to monitor the emails and ensure that staff are enrolling in appropriate training.

section.title: Setting up your Corporate Pass within onCourse
section.para: This section will outline how you can set up your Corporate Pass using the onCourse Client

listitem.para: To create a new Corporate Pass first click on the 'Corporate Pass' window within the Marketing Tab of the onCourse Client. You can then create a new Corporate Pass by clicking on the +symbol in the top right hand corner of the opened window.

caption.para: The Corporate Pass window can be accessed via the Marketing Tab

listitem.para: The minimum required information to create a new Corporate Pass is a contact or Company Name and a Password. Remember that the Company or Contact must already exist as a record within onCourse prior to creating the Corporate Pass.
You can also specify as to which email address the invoices will be sent to. An expiry date can also be set for a given Corporate Pass, but this is not a required field.
You can now define as to which Class or Classes are able to be enrolled in using this Corporate Pass in the following ways:
Add all of your Classes to a Corporate Pass, this Pass will be valid for any current or pending Classes.
Add a single Class to a Corporate Pass, this Pass will only be valid for the specified Class

caption.para: Enter Name, Course Code and Class Code

listitem.para: Add all Classes for a given Course to a Corporate Pass, this pass is valid for any current and future Classes of the specified Course
Add all Classes which have a specified subject tag. This pass will be valid for any current or future Classes which has this specific subject tag

section.para:
Once you have assigned the Corporate Pass to the specified Contact or Company and set whatever parameters in terms of which Classes can be enrolled against using the Corporate Pass, this is all that is needed to activate the Corporate Pass.
If you don't specify any Classes within your Corporate Pass, this will mean that the Pass can be used to enrol in any Class that is published on your website.

section.title: Using the Corporate Pass to Enrol Online
section.para: Once the Corporate Pass has been created and the College notifies the client of the password for the Corporate Pass, the client can then use the Corporate Pass to enrol online. When the enrolment is confirmed and the Corporate Pass has been validated, this will automatically send an enrolment confirmation email to the student and an invoice for payment to the designated Contact or Company that the Corporate Pass has been issued to.
The process of enrolling online using a Corporate Password is quite straightforward:

listitem.para: The client will browse and select the Class or Classes they wish to enrol in, then proceed to the check out to complete the enrolment transaction.

Once you proceed to the checkout, the onCourse website will ask you to confirm the contact details of the student as well as the Class or Classes that you wish to enrol in are correct, you can click on the Proceed to Paymentbutton.
The payment view will you give you two options, pay by Credit Card or pay using a Corporate Pass, simply select payment via Corporate Pass.
Simply the enter the password for the Corporate Pass and press submit

caption.para: Enter the Password to validate the Corporate Pass

listitem.para: The system will then verify whether a valid code has been entered and specify as to whom will be invoiced for this Class Enrolment, you can then confirm you agree to the enrolment conditions and click on Confirm enrolmentto complete the process.

caption.para: Once the password is validated, confirm the enrolment

section.title: Monitoring the Use of Corporate Passes within onCourse
section.para: Once the Corporate Pass has been created, you can very easily monitor the use of it via the Corporate Pass window of the onCourse Client. The list view will give you a heads up on how many times a given Corporate Pass has been used. You can also filter the view to only show Currententries using the Core Filter function of this window.

caption.para: Summary view of all Corporate Passes

section.para: To view the details of a given Corporate Pass, simply click on the hi-lighted record to open this up in edit view. From this view you can update the paramaters of a the Pass including valid to date and or assign different Classes to the Corporate Pass.

By clicking on the Invoicetab, you can view all Invoices that have been issued for that Corporate Pass. As well as the date the Invoice was issued, the Invoice # and the amount owing for that invoice.
By clicking on an invoice entry, you can then see all of the detailed information for the Invoice including the invoice line details and access any payments made against the Invoice.
Apart from utilizing the onCourse Client to monitor usage of your Corporate Passes, there are also several onCourse Reports available to help you monitor this aspect of your business.
To access these reports simply hilight the records within the Corporate Pass list view, then select FilePrintto open up the Report window.
